content: On July 25, 1991, the Atlanta Braves experienced a pivotal moment in their season when they defeated the New York Mets 4-3 in a thrilling game at Fulton County Stadium. This victory was significant as it marked the beginning of a remarkable second half of the season that propelled the Braves toward an eventual National League pennant. The game featured a standout performance by pitcher Tom Glavine, who played a crucial role in the Braves' success during that year, showcasing the team's growth into a contender.
